column4: I have an external mybook 500gb hdd which I use to store my data. I just plugged it in ubuntu, and a message appeared: "one or more disks are failing" and there is a red message "disk failure is imminent" What can I do?
backup that data as best you can and try to get the drive serviced by the company.
ok, I think that is quite obvious but then my question would be: Can I reformat or do something to fix that hdd?
no, it needs to be replaced by the company
